model_answer: The detectorist pulls out a ring from the plug, and the 78 signal on the detector leads him to think it might not be gold. (Option A)

The most reliable evidence for the gold content of the ring is option B: An on-screen text identifies it as a 14K yellow gold ring with white gold crosses. This is because it is a specific and detailed description provided by someone with expertise in jewelry, and it matches the description given by the speaker later in the video. The other options may be suggestive but are not as conclusive without additional context or confirmation from other sources.
